00037 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00038 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00039 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00040    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00041    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but uses a dedicated
00042    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00043 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00044 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00045 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00046 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00048 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ 4096
00049 
00050 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00051 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00052 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)

00054 #define xnarch_alloc_stack xnmalloc
00055 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00057 struct xnthread;
00058 struct task_struct;
00059 
00060 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00061 
00062     /* Kernel mode side */
00063     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00064     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00065     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00066     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00067     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00068 
00069     /* User mode side */
00070     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00071     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00072 
00073     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00074     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00075     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00076 
00077 } xnarchtcb_t;
00078 
00079 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00080 
00081     unsigned vector;
00082     long errcode;
00083     struct pt_regs *regs;
00084 
00085 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00086 
00087 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00088 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00090 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00091    Linux stack context. */
00092 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00093                                  ((fi)->vector != 1 && (fi)->vector != 3))

00098 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00099 
00100 {
00101     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00102         return vmalloc(bytes);
00103 
00104     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00105 }
00106 
00107 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00108 
00109 {
00110     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00111         vfree(chunk);
00112     else
00113         kfree(chunk);
00114 }

00116 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00117 {
00118     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00119 }

00121 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00122 
00123 {
00124     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00125 }

00133 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00134                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00135     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00138 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00139 
00140 {
00141     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00142 
00143     adeos_load_cpuid();
00144 
00145     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00146        and always inside a critical section. */
00147     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00148     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00149     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00150     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00151     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00152 }
00153 
00154 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00155 {
00156     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00157 }
00158 
00159 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00160                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00161                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00162                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00163                                     )
00164 {
00165 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00166 
00167     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00168         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00169         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00170         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00171         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00172         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00173         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00174         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00175         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00176         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00177         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00178         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00179         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00180         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00181         "ret\n\t" \
00182 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00183         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00184         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00185       : /* no output */ \
00186       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00187         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00188         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00189         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00190         "b" (out_tcb), \
00191         "S" (in_tcb), \
00192         "a" (outproc), \
00193         "d" (inproc));
00194 
00195 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00196 
00197     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00198     
00199     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00200         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00201         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00202         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00203         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00204         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00205         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00206         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00207         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00208         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00209         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00210         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00211         "ret\n\t" \
00212 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00213       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00214         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00215         "=S" (esi_out), \
00216         "=D" (edi_out), \
00217         "+a" (outproc), \
00218         "+d" (inproc) \
00219       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00220         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00221         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00222         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00223 
00224 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00225 }
00226 
00227 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00228                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00229 {
00230     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00231     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00232 
00233     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00234         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00235            clear the ts bit. */
00236         clts();
00237     
00238     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00239 
00240     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00241         {
00242         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00243 
00244         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00245 
00246         if (!inproc->mm)
00247             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00248         }
00249 
00250     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00251 
00252     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00253 
00254         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00255            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00256            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00257            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00258            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00259            raw I/O ops. */
00260 
00261         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00262 
00263         barrier();
00264 
00265         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00266             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00267 
00268             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00269                 
00270                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00271 
00272                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00273                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00274                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00275                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00276 
00277                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00278                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00279             }
00280         }
00281     }
00282 
00283     stts();
00284 }
00285 
00286 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00287                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00288 {
00289     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00290 }
00291 
00292 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00293 {
00294     /* Empty */
00295 }
00296 
00297 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00298                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00299                                          const char *name)
00300 {
00301     tcb->user_task = current;
00302     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00303     tcb->esp = 0;
00304     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00305     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00306     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00307 }
00308 
00309 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00310                                                int imask,
00311                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00312                                                void *cookie)
00313 {
00314     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00315     stts();
00316     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00317     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00318     entry(cookie);
00319     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00320 }
00321 
00322 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00323                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00324                                        void *cookie,
00325                                        int imask,
00326                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00327                                        char *name)
00328 {
00329     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00330 
00331     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00332     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00333     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00334     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00335     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00336     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00337     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00338     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00339     *--(*psp) = 0;
00340 }
00341 
00342 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00343 
00344 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00345 
00346 {
00347     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00348        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00349 
00350     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00351 
00352     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00353         {
00354         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00355         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00356         }
00357 }
00358 
00359 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00360 
00361 {
00362     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00363     
00364     if(task)
00365         {
00366         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00367             return;
00368 
00369         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00370            of this task. */
00371         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00372         }
00373 
00374     clts();
00375     
00376     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00377         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00378     else
00379         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00380 }
00381 
00382 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00383 
00384 {
00385     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00386 
00387     if (task)
00388         {
00389 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00390         if (!tsk_used_math(task))
00391 #else
00392         if (!task->used_math)
00393 #endif
00394             {
00395             stts();
00396             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00397             }
00398 
00399         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00400            hardware. */
00401         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00402         }
00403 
00404     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00405        user-space or kernel thread. */
00406     clts();
00407 
00408     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00409         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00410     else
00411         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00412 }
00413 
00414 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00415 
00416 {
00417     clts();
00418 
00419     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00420     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00421        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00422         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00423 }
00424 
00425 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00426 
00427 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00428 
00429 {}
00430 
00431 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00432 
00433 {}
00434 
00435 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00436 
00437 {}
00438 
00439 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00440 
00441 {}
00442 
00443 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */

00447 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00448 
00449     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00450 }
00451 
00452 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00453 
00454 {
00455     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00456                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00457                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00458                                      NULL,
00459                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00460 }
00461 
00462 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00463 
00464 {
00465     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00466                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00467                                      NULL,
00468                                      NULL,
00469                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00470 }
00471 
00472 static struct linux_semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00473 
00474 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00475 {
00476     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00477 }
00478 
00479 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00480     
00481 {
00482     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00483     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00484     unsigned long flags;
00485     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00486 
00487     sema_init(&xnarch_finalize_sync,0);
00488 
00489     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00490        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00491        context. */
00492     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00493                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00494 
00495     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00496     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00497     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00498     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00499 
00500     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00501         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00502     
00503     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00504                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00505 }
00506 
00507 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00508 
00509 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00510 
00511     return 0;
00512 }
00513 
00514 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00515 
00516     return 0;
00517 }
00518 
00519 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00520 
00521     return 0;
00522 }
00523 
00524 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00525 
00526 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00527 
00528 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00529 
00530 {
00531 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00532     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00533        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00534     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00535 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00536 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00537     xnshadow_release_events();
00538 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00539     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00540     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00541     schedule_timeout(50);
00542     xnarch_release_ipi();
00543 }
00544 
00545 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00546 
00547 {
00548     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00549 
00550     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00551         {
00552         spl_t s;
00553         splsync(s);
00554         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00555         splexit(s);
00556         return 1;
00557         }
00558 
00559     return 0;
00560 }
00561 
00562 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00563 
00564 {
00565 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00566     xnshadow_grab_events();
00567 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00568 }
00569 
00570 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00572 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00573 
00574 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00575 {
00576     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00577     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00578     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00579     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00580     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00581     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00582 }
00583 
00584 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00585 
00586 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00587 
00588 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00589                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00590                                            const char *name)
00591 {
00592     struct task_struct *task = current;
00593 
00594     tcb->user_task = task;
00595     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00596     tcb->esp = 0;
00597     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00598     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00599     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00600 }
00601 
00602 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00603 
00604 {
00605     unsigned irq;
00606 
00607     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00608         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00609                              handler,
00610                              NULL,
00611                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00612 }
00613 
00614 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00615 
00616 {
00617     unsigned irq;
00618 
00619     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00620         {
00621         switch (irq)
00622             {
00623 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00624             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00625             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00626             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00627             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00628 
00629                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00630                 continue;
00631 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00632 
00633             default:
00634 
00635                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00636             }
00637         }
00638 }
00639 
00640 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00641 
00642 {
00643     unsigned irq;
00644 
00645     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00646         {
00647         switch (irq)
00648             {
00649 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00650             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00651             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00652             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00653             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00654 
00655                 continue;
00656 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00657 
00658             default:
00659 
00660                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00661             }
00662         }
00663 }
00664 
00665 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00666 
00667 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00668 
00669 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00670     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00671        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00672        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00673        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00674     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00675 }
00676 
00677 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00678     rthal_timer_release();
00679 }
00680 
00681 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00682 
00683 {
00684 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00685     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00686 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00687     return 0;
00688 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00689 }
00690 
00691 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00692                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00693                                         unsigned long long defval)
00694 {
00695 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00696     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00697     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00698     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00699 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00700     *shot = defval;
00701     *delivery = defval;
00702 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00703 }
00704 
00705 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00706 
00707 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00708 
00709 #include <linux/init.h>
00710 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00711 
00712 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00713 
00714 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00715 
00716 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00717 
00718 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00719 
00720 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00721 
00722 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00723 
00724 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00725 {
00726     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00727 
00728     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00729     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00730     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00731 
00732     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00733 }
00734 
00735 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00736 
00737 {
00738 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00739     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00740 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00741     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00742        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00743        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00744        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00745        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00746        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00747     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00748 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00749 }
00750 
00751 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00752 
00753 {
00754     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00755 
00756     if (!nktimerlat)
00757         return -ENODEV;
00758 
00759     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00760 
00761     return 0;
00762 }
00763 
00764 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00765 
00766 {
00767     int err;
00768 
00769 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00770     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00771        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00772     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00773 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00774 
00775     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00776 
00777     if (err)
00778         return err;
00779 
00780     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00781 
00782     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00783         return -ENOSYS;
00784 
00785     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00786                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00787                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00788                               NULL,
00789                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00790 
00791     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00792 
00793 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00794     err = xnshadow_mount();
00795 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00796 
00797     if (err)
00798         {
00799         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00800         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00801         }
00802 
00803     return err;
00804 }
00805 
00806 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00807 
00808 {
00809 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00810     xnshadow_cleanup();
00811 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00812     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00813     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00814 }
00815 
00816 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00817 
00818 #ifdef __cplusplus
00819 }
00820 #endif
00821 
00822 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00823 
00824 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00825 
00826 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00827 
00828 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
